ڈوبنے والی ریت کسی شخص کو تیزی سے ڈبونے: Can quicksand cause a person to sink quickly? Quicksand sinking speed

Quicksand has a density of about 2 grams per cubic centimeter, whereas the density of the human body is only about 1 gram per cubic centimeter. At that level of density, sinking beyond about waist height in quicksand is impossible. Even objects with a higher density than quicksand will float on it if stationary.
Can quicksand cause a person to sink quickly? Quicksand sinking speed
It was really quite fast and the more you struggle, the deeper you can sink. I wouldn't say it's harmless but it can be quite scary.
Can quicksand cause a person to sink quickly? Quicksand sinking speed
It is impossible for a human to sink entirely into quicksand, due to the higher density of the fluid.
Can quicksand cause a person to sink quickly? Quicksand sinking speed
And if a person flails around in quicksand, the sucking effect caused by the moving limbs can cause a person to sink deeper into the goo.
Can quicksand cause a person to sink quickly? Quicksand sinking speed

Can quicksand cause a person to sink quickly? Quicksand sinking speed

ڈوبنے والی ریت کسی چیز کو تیزی سے ڈبونے: Can quicksand cause objects to sink rapidly? How does quicksand work?

At higher stresses, quicksand liquefies very quickly, and the higher the stress the more fluid it becomes. This causes a trapped body to sink when it starts to move. But a person moving around in quicksand will never go all the way under.
Can quicksand cause objects to sink rapidly? How does quicksand work?

detail.reasoning: The given text claims that quicksand can cause a person to sink rapidly. However, the provided evidences suggest that while quicksand can cause a person to sink, it is not possible for a person to sink entirely due to the higher density of quicksand compared to the human body. The evidences indicate that sinking beyond waist height is impossible and that quicksand is not as dangerous as often portrayed, as objects with a higher density than quicksand will float if stationary. Therefore, the claim that quicksand can cause a person to sink rapidly is misleading.
